title: U.S. to Send Virus-Ravaged India Materials for Vaccines

title: ‘No Excuse Not to Be Vaccinated’ in Texas, Which Expands Eligibility to All Adults

title: ‘Believe Your Eyes,’ Prosecutor Tells Jury on First Day of Derek Chauvin Trial
first_paragraph: For nearly a year, the country’s understanding of George Floyd’s death has come mostly from a gruesome video of a white Minneapolis police officer kneeling on Mr. Floyd’s neck for more than nine minutes. It has become, for many, a painful encapsulation of racism in policing.

title: Biden Pushes Mask Mandate as C.D.C. Director Warns of ‘Impending Doom’
first_paragraph: President Biden, facing a rise in coronavirus cases around the country, called on Monday for governors and mayors to reinstate mask mandates as the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned of “impending doom” from a potential fourth surge of the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
first_paragraph: With the vaccine supply set to increase substantially, more states are opening up vaccine eligibility to all adults.

title: A ‘major technical glitch’ brings an abrupt end to the first day in court.
first_paragraph: The judge overseeing Derek Chauvin’s murder trial made history last year when he said he would allow television cameras to stream the trial live, a first in Minnesota history. But on Monday afternoon, the feed failed, bringing an abrupt end to the first day of one of the most anticipated criminal trials in recent memory.

title: What we know about the judge in the Derek Chauvin trial.
first_paragraph: Judge Peter A. Cahill is a 14-year veteran of the bench in Hennepin County. He has previously worked as a public defender, private defense lawyer and prosecutor, rising to become chief deputy under Amy Klobuchar, now a U.S. senator, when she served as the county attorney.

title: A majority of school districts are now open. But not everyone wants to return.
first_paragraph: Elementary students returned to classrooms in Long Beach, Calif., on Monday and campuses from Los Angeles to Boston prepared for significant expansions of in-person instruction as a majority of the nation’s districts have now begun to reopen school buildings, many of which have been closed for more than a year.

title: The C.D.C. extends its moratorium on evictions until June 30 to ease hardships caused by the virus.
first_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has extended its nationwide moratorium on evictions through June 30, pushing it back from the end of March, when it had been scheduled to lapse.

title: ‘There’s just a sense of entitlement’: Hawaiians worry about a flood of heedless tourists.
first_paragraph: Palakiko Chandler took their little cousins to Nanakuli Beach on Oahu last weekend and noticed something they hadn’t seen in a while: a parking lot full of rental cars. The tourists were back.

title: As Pandemic Upends Teaching, Fewer Students Want to Pursue It

title: Michigan G.O.P. Chair Is Criticized After Calling State’s Top Democrats ‘Witches’

Trump.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today

title: 9-Year-Old Migrant Girl Dies Trying to Cross Rio Grande Into U.S.
first_paragraph: A 9-year-old migrant girl drowned while trying to cross the Rio Grande into Texas with her family, according to federal authorities, the first reported death of a child in a new surge of migration along the southwestern border.

title: At least 34 states are giving all adults vaccine access by mid-April, and more aim to by Biden’s May 1 goal.
first_paragraph: States are racing to vaccinate as many people as possible as the United States’ coronavirus infection curve continues its plateau for a third week at more than 55,000 new cases per day, a level that health experts warn could rapidly escalate into a new wave.

title: For Biden, a New Virus Dilemma: How to Handle a Looming Glut of Vaccine

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
first_paragraph: Joe Biden held his first presidential news conference this afternoon and announced a new goal: His administration would administer 200 million vaccines within his first 100 days in office, or April 30, double his initial goal.

title: 200 million vaccines in 100 days is the new goal, Biden says, though the U.S. is already on track to meet that.
first_paragraph: President Biden, who said when he was inaugurated that he would have “100 million shots in the arms” of Americans by his 100th day in office, announced Thursday at his news conference that he is doubling that goal.

title: To keep the virus off a campus, test beyond its borders, a new study suggests.

title: Voting Rights Bill Puts Democrats on a Crash Course With the Filibuster

title: Mississippi Will Remove ‘Misleading’ Language About Covid-19 Vaccine
first_paragraph: Bobby Wayne, a retired reverend with prostate cancer and leukemia, had spent a week calling health agencies around his county in Mississippi, trying to find out where to get the Covid-19 vaccine.

title: As virus cases plateau nationally, Michigan’s rapid surge worries experts.
first_paragraph: In a sea of heartening news about the U.S. battle against the coronavirus, some experts are casting worried glances at a cloud on the horizon: Michigan, where new cases and hospitalizations are rising with alarming speed.

title: More than 40 states say they will meet or beat Biden’s May 1 deadline for vaccine eligibility for all adults.
first_paragraph: The push to get Americans vaccinated has picked up momentum in recent days. Governors and public health officials in more than 40 states have said they will meet or beat President Biden’s goal of making every adult eligible for a vaccine by May 1, and at least 30 states plan to start universal eligibility in March or April.

title: How Can Schools Use $129 Billion in Covid Relief Funds?
first_paragraph: The $1.9 trillion relief plan has a lot of money going to education. About $129 billion goes directly to K-12 education. Before a school reopening summit meeting on Wednesday, President Biden announced the release of $81 billion of the funds. Separately, colleges and universities will get about $40 billion.

title: A program that boosted rapid testing in Canada will try to do the same in the U.S.
first_paragraph: A team of Canadian researchers who brought together some of that country’s largest businesses to scale up a rapid coronavirus testing program is now trying to replicate its success in the United States, with the aim of reviving the economy and getting thousands of Americans back to work.

title: White House Pledges Asian-American Focus After Democrats Threaten Nominees
first_paragraph: The White House said Tuesday that it would appoint a senior official to focus on Asian-American priorities after the Senate’s two Asian-American Democrats called on President Biden to address what they said was an unacceptable lack of representation at the highest levels of his administration.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today

title: Texas, Indiana and Georgia are making all adults eligible for Covid-19 vaccination.
first_paragraph: Texas, Indiana and Georgia announced Tuesday that residents 16 years and older will be eligible for Covid-19 vaccinations starting Thursday for Georgia residents, Monday for Texans and on March 31 for Indianans. They joining a growing list of states that plan to broaden vaccine eligibility to all adults ahead of a May 1 deadline set by President Biden.

title: Grocery store workers dealt with ‘worst of the worst’ even before the Boulder shooting.
first_paragraph: The shooting at a grocery store in Boulder, Colo., that left 10 people dead came after a year in which the pandemic made supermarkets a dangerous place for employees, who risked falling ill with the coronavirus and often had to confront combative customers who refused to wear masks.

title: Harris Visits Florida to Sell Stimulus Package in a Republican-Led State
first_paragraph: Vice President Kamala Harris urged the public to receive vaccinations during a visit on Monday to Florida, a Republican-led state that has largely remained open for business despite concerns that doing so may prolong the pandemic.

title: How the Pandemic Changed Your Politics

title: Louisiana House Race Sets Up a Democratic Showdown in New Orleans
first_paragraph: The first competitive special congressional election of the Biden era is most likely heading to a runoff next month, but the battle lines are already drawn ahead of the initial balloting on Saturday in the race to succeed former Representative Cedric L. Richmond of Louisiana.

title: Confronting Violence Against Asians, Biden Says That ‘We Cannot Be Complicit’
first_paragraph: President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris traveled on Friday to Atlanta to express grief for the victims of a mass shooting that left eight people dead, six of them women of Asian descent, describing the tragedy as part of an increase in racially motivated violence and pledging to take action against hate and discrimination.

title: House Votes to Avert Deep Medicare Cuts to Pay for $1.9 Trillion Stimulus Plan
first_paragraph: The House voted on Friday to avert an estimated $36 billion in cuts to Medicare next year and tens of billions more from farm subsidies and other social safety net programs, moving to stave off deep spending reductions that would otherwise be made to pay for the $1.9 trillion stimulus bill enacted last week.

title: Democrats Confront a Surge at the Border
first_paragraph: The Democratic-led House on Thursday passed bills that would offer a path to citizenship for millions of undocumented immigrants, including so-called Dreamers, and eventually grant legal status to almost a million farmworkers and their families.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
first_paragraph: States are racing to expand vaccine eligibility to all adults as part of a sprint to meet President Biden’s goal of universal vaccine access by May 1.

title: As Republicans Shun Vaccines, Congress Toils to Return to Normal
first_paragraph: Even as Americans across the country hunt for a lifesaving shot in a bid to get back to a semblance of prepandemic normalcy, more than a quarter of members of Congress, just a phone call away from receiving a coronavirus vaccine, have turned it down.

title: Border Towns Brace for More Migrants as the Border Slowly Reopens
first_paragraph: Immigration agents are releasing so many migrants in small towns along the Texas border these days that Laura Ramos, who owns a store near the international bridge in Eagle Pass, said she was worried about the safety of her business and her children.

title: In Restricting Early Voting, the Right Sees a New ‘Center of Gravity’

Anthony List and the American Principles Project have pursued cultural and policy priorities from the social conservative playbook, one backing laws to ban abortion once a fetal heartbeat could be detected and the other opposing civil rights protections for L.G.B.T.Q. people. From their shared offices in suburban Virginia, they and their affiliated committees spent more than $20 million on elections last year.

title: U.S. Rushes to Expand Covid Vaccine Eligibility in a ‘Race Against Time’

title: Asian-American Lawmakers Call Out Racist Language: ‘I Am Not a Virus’

title: After Georgia Attacks, Asian-Americans Demand Serious Action on Bias

title: Homelessness in U.S. Rose for 4th Straight Year, Report Says
first_paragraph: Homelessness in the United States rose for the fourth straight year, with about 580,000 people living on the streets or in temporary shelter at the start of 2020, according to an annual nationwide survey that was completed before the pandemic.

title: Biden’s Aid Package Funnels Millions to Victims of Domestic Abuse
first_paragraph: Tucked into President Biden’s $1.9 trillion pandemic relief package are tens of millions of dollars for organizations dedicated to curtailing domestic abuse, which skyrocketed during the pandemic, as well as vouchers for people fleeing violence at home, to help them find safe shelter and rebuild their lives.

title: Tribal Communities Set to Receive Big New Infusion of Aid
first_paragraph: After a year that provided stark new evidence of how racial inequities and a lack of federal funding had left tribal communities and Indigenous people especially vulnerable to crises like the pandemic, President Biden and Democrats in Congress are seeking to address those longstanding issues with a huge infusion of federal aid.

title: White House to Spend Billions to Increase Virus Testing and Ease Reopening
first_paragraph: The Biden administration, moving to address a lag in coronavirus testing that is hindering the reopening of schools and the economy, said Wednesday that it would invest $10 billion to ramp up screening of students and educators with the goal of returning to in-person learning by the end of the school year.

title: Biden Administration Faces Legal Fight Over State Aid Restrictions on Tax Cuts
first_paragraph: State backlash against a restriction in the $1.9 trillion economic relief legislation that prohibits local governments from using aid money to cut taxes emerged as the Biden administration’s first major legal battle on Wednesday, as Ohio sued to block the provision and other states considered similar action.

title: House Renews Landmark Domestic Violence Bill, but Obstacles Wait in Senate
first_paragraph: The House moved on Wednesday to renew the Violence Against Women Act, adding firearm restrictions for convicted domestic abusers and other new provisions to a landmark law that has helped combat domestic violence, sexual assault and stalking but expired in 2019.

title: Culture Wars Leave Biden’s Health Leadership Posts Vacant

title: How 535,000 Covid Deaths Spurred Political Awakenings Across America

title: Covid Outbreaks Devastated Prisons, but State Inmates’ Access to the Vaccine Varies Widely

title: Kamala Harris says the Atlanta attacks have ‘frightened and shocked and outraged all people.’
first_paragraph: Authorities, Atlanta residents and Asian-American groups across the country reacted with shock and outrage to the massage parlor shootings that killed eight people on Tuesday evening.

title: ‘When Normal Life Stopped’: College Essays Reflect a Turbulent Year
first_paragraph: This year perhaps more than ever before, the college essay has served as a canvas for high school seniors to reflect on a turbulent and, for many, sorrowful year. It has been a psychiatrist’s couch, a road map to a more hopeful future, a chance to pour out intimate feelings about loneliness and injustice.

title: Treasury Ramps Up Racial Equity Review as It Deploys Relief Funds
first_paragraph: The Treasury Department is moving ahead with a formal racial equity review of the agency and its programs, putting in place an effort to ensure that economic fairness is prioritized throughout the Biden administration as it begins to disburse $1.9 trillion in relief money.

title: Indianapolis Man Killed 4 After Fight Over Stimulus Check, Police Say

title: Surge in Migrants Defies Easy or Quick Solutions for Biden

title: 8 People Killed in Atlanta-Area Massage Parlor Shootings
first_paragraph: Eight people were shot to death at three massage parlors in the Atlanta area on Tuesday evening, the authorities said, raising fears that the crimes may have targeted people of Asian descent.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today

title: Children Are Sleeping on Mats in Overcrowded Border Facilities
first_paragraph: Migrant children are being forced to sleep on gym mats with foil sheets and go for days without showering as the Border Patrol struggles to handle thousands of young Central Americans who are surging across the southwestern border, some of them as young as a year old.

title: Can Biden Stay on the Sidelines of the Andrew Cuomo Saga?

title: As Biden Confronts Vaccine Hesitancy, Republicans Are a Particular Challenge

title: Biden heralds the deployment of 100 million shots and 100 million stimulus checks.

title: California’s First Latino Senator Wants Immigration Overhaul Now

title: Biden picks Gene Sperling, a Democratic policy aide, to oversee spending from the $1.9 trillion relief plan.
first_paragraph: President Biden has tapped Gene Sperling, a longtime top economic aide to Democratic presidents, to oversee spending from the $1.9 trillion relief package that the president signed into law last week and planned to promote across the country this week.

title: Stimulus Bill as a Political Weapon? Democrats Are Counting on It.
first_paragraph: Triumphant over the signing of their far-reaching $1.9 trillion stimulus package, Democrats are now starting to angle for a major political payoff that would defy history: Picking up House and Senate seats in the 2022 midterm elections, even though the party in power usually loses in the midterms.

title: Biden Administration Directs FEMA to Help Shelter Migrant Children
first_paragraph: The Biden administration is directing the Federal Emergency Management Agency to assist in processing an increasing number of children and teenagers who have filled detention facilities at the southwest border, as criticism mounts over the treatment of young migrants.

title: Fewer than half of states are giving vaccine access to U.S. Postal Service workers.
first_paragraph: Beleaguered in the pandemic and thrust into the spotlight by the 2020 election, the United States Postal Service now finds itself competing for its share of the vaccine.

title: Which vaccines are available in the U.S. now, and which may be coming?
first_paragraph: About 20 percent of the U.S. population has received at least one Covid-19 vaccine shot as the pace of inoculations in the United States sharply climbs. title: Police Shrugged Off the Proud Boys, Until They Attacked the Capitol

title: Three Uber passengers coughed on a driver and ripped off his mask. Two have been arrested.
first_paragraph: Two arrests have been made after scenes from a viral video that circulated showed passengers taunting and deliberately coughing on an Uber driver.

title: After Breonna Taylor’s Death, Black Engagement in Kentucky Politics Soared
first_paragraph: Exactly one year ago, a young woman died as a barrage of police gunfire ripped through the walls of her modest apartment in Louisville, Ky. For months, her death went largely unrecognized.

title: After a 28-Year Ban, Alabama Could Allow Yoga in Public Schools
first_paragraph: For nearly three decades, teaching yoga in Alabama’s public schools has been forbidden by the state’s school board.

title: Global vaccination rates are on the rise, but many countries have yet to start.
first_paragraph: More than 345 million doses of Covid-19 vaccines have been administered worldwide in the three months since mass inoculation began in December, but there is still a huge disparity in the vaccination rates between countries.

title: Refugee Flights Canceled as Biden Fails to Lift Trump Cutback
first_paragraph: More than 715 refugees from around the world who expected to start new lives in the United States have had their flights canceled in recent weeks because President Biden has postponed an overhaul of his predecessor’s sharp limits on new refugee admissions.

title: How Democrats Hope to Press Their Advantage on the Stimulus
first_paragraph: President Biden signed his $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief bill into law yesterday, a move that will send $1,400 stimulus checks to many Americans, strengthen a wide range of social programs and step up investment in vaccine distribution. A few hours later, he went on national television to trumpet the achievement. And this afternoon, he celebrated it in a Rose Garden ceremony, joined by Democratic leaders in Congress.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
first_paragraph: So much of this newsletter can be doom and gloom, but today we’re going to talk about a sunnier outlook. This week I heard that my colleague Ezra Klein, an Opinion columnist, was working on a podcast episode about the near future of the pandemic that was highly optimistic. That was surprising news, given that just a few weeks ago Ezra penned a rather bleak column about the virus.

title: A Last-Minute Add to Stimulus Bill Could Restrict State Tax Cuts

title: Biden Takes First Tentative Steps to Address Global Vaccine Shortage

title: The U.S. will partner with Japan, India and Australia to expand global vaccine supply.
first_paragraph: The Biden administration, under intense pressure to donate excess coronavirus vaccines to needy nations, is moving to address the global shortage in another way: by partnering with Japan, India and Australia to finance a dramatic expansion of the vaccine manufacturing capacity.

title: With a Rose Garden celebration, Biden takes a victory lap.
first_paragraph: One day after President Biden gave a televised address promising that his $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan would help lift up an economy stunned by the coronavirus pandemic, he entered the Rose Garden to a standing ovation from an audience of Democrats.

title: Colorado Braces for a Major Snowstorm This Weekend

title: In Nevada, Unemployed Workers Wait for Aid That Will Still Not Be Enough

title: Here’s a fact-check of Biden’s first prime-time White House address.

title: Biden Tells Nation There Is Hope After a Devastating Year

title: Biden condemns ‘vicious’ hate crimes against Asian-Americans.

title: The Lessons of One of the Worst Years in American Life

title: The Fight Is On to Define the Pandemic Aid Bill

title: The U.S. Is Sitting on Tens of Millions of Vaccine Doses the World Needs

title: Biden’s new role as a crusader for the poor is an evolution from decades as ‘Scranton Joe.’

title: U.S. Releases New Covid-19 Guidance for Nursing Homes, Permitting Indoor Visits

title: Congress Clears $1.9 Trillion Aid Bill, Sending It to Biden
first_paragraph: Congress gave final approval on Wednesday to President Biden’s sweeping, nearly $1.9 trillion stimulus package, as Democrats acted over unified Republican opposition to push through an emergency pandemic aid plan that carries out a vast expansion of the country’s social safety net.

title: What Does $1.9 Trillion Buy?
first_paragraph: Seven weeks into President Biden’s term, his first major piece of legislation, the American Rescue Plan Act, is set to become law. The House passed a final version of the bill this afternoon, and it now heads to Biden’s desk, where he is expected to sign it on Friday.

title: Blinken Will Meet Chinese Officials After Asia Tour Next Week

first_paragraph: For teachers and students, the brutal storm that burst pipes, disabled power grids and left usually temperate cities coated in snow and ice has further derailed an uncertain school year across much of the South and Midwest.

first_paragraph: In his first official trip away from Washington since taking office, President Biden on Tuesday offered reassurance to Americans about the availability of the coronavirus vaccines and optimism that his $1.9 trillion relief bill was the kind of ambitious plan that could restore the American economy.

first_paragraph: As Senators Susan Collins of Maine and Lisa Murkowski of Alaska walked the halls of the Capitol recently, the two moderate Republicans marveled to each other about how much time President Biden had spent with them during a meeting in the Oval Office.

title: The House moves to finalize the next coronavirus stimulus package by end of next week.
first_paragraph: House Democrats are finalizing the details of President Biden’s $1.9 trillion economic relief package, and barreling toward a vote on the final legislation at the end of next week.

first_paragraph: The N.A.A.C.P. on Tuesday morning filed a federal lawsuit against former President Donald J. Trump and his personal lawyer Rudolph W. Giuliani, claiming that they violated a 19th century statute when they tried to prevent the certification of the election on Jan. 6.

first_paragraph: After a bitter fight, the Chicago Public Schools reached a deal with its teachers’ union last week to reopen elementary and middle schools amid the pandemic. By early March, students who have been learning remotely for 10 months will be back in the classrooms.

title: A Year of Hardship, Helped and Hindered by Washington
first_paragraph: When the coronavirus pandemic struck last March, Kathryn Stewart was working at a gas station in rural Michigan and living in her mother’s trailer with eight relatives, three dogs and a budget with no room for error. Her mother, who is disabled, soon urged her to quit to avoid bringing home the disease. Ms. Stewart reluctantly agreed, wondering how she would support herself and her 10-year-old son.

title: Another First for an Impeachment Trial: Meeting During a Pandemic
first_paragraph: During the last impeachment trial of President Donald J. Trump, as reporters prowled the Senate hallways awaiting word on whether a key Republican might vote to allow witnesses to be heard, senators were behind closed doors receiving a disturbing briefing about a new virus spreading through China.

title: Under Pressure, California Church Postpones Conference for Thousands
first_paragraph: An evangelical megachurch, under pressure from health officials, said on Friday that it had postponed an indoor conference that was expected to draw as many as 3,000 people from across the country to Southern California.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today

first_paragraph: When Senate Republicans sought recently to wall off some federal education aid from schools that decline to reopen once teachers can be vaccinated, a top Democrat accused them of staging a “political show.” If it was, it was a show Republicans were more than happy to put on.

title: Three Men Are Accused in Scheme to Sell Covid-19 Vaccines
first_paragraph: Three Baltimore men have been accused by federal prosecutors of putting up a fake website to sell Covid-19 vaccines for $30 a dose, prosecutors say.

title: The C.D.C. Has New School Guidelines. Here’s What You Need to Know.
first_paragraph: In a move long awaited by educators, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention released new guidelines on Friday for how to operate schools safely during the pandemic.

title: F.D.A. Agrees Moderna Can Increase Vaccine Supply in Each Vial
first_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration has informed the drugmaker Moderna that it can put up to 40 percent more coronavirus vaccine into each of its vials, a simple and potentially rapid way to bolster strained supplies, according to people familiar with the company’s operations.

title: Will Massachusetts’s Vaccine Buddy System Work? Well, It’s Worth a Shot
first_paragraph: Gloria Clark of Malden, Mass., woke up on Thursday with one goal and one goal only: to find herself an unvaccinated person over the age of 75.

title: With More Vaccines Secured, Biden Warns of Hurdles to Come
first_paragraph: The Biden administration said Thursday it had secured 200 million more doses of coronavirus vaccines, enough to inoculate every American adult, but President Biden warned that logistical hurdles would most likely mean that many Americans will still not have been vaccinated by the end of the summer.

title: Biden Trims Ambitions on School Reopening Pledge

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
first_paragraph: Dr. Anthony Fauci, President Biden’s chief medical adviser for Covid-19, said today that most members of the general public could become eligible to get the coronavirus vaccine as early as April.

title: Trump Was Sicker Than Acknowledged With Covid-19
first_paragraph: President Donald J. Trump was sicker with Covid-19 in October than publicly acknowledged at the time, with extremely depressed blood oxygen levels at one point and a lung problem associated with pneumonia caused by the coronavirus, according to four people familiar with his condition.

title: ‘Open season’ for vaccine eligibility could come in April, Fauci says.
first_paragraph: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, President Biden’s chief medical adviser for Covid-19, said Thursday that most members of the general public could become eligible to get the coronavirus vaccine as soon as April.

title: Race and the pandemic: A Biden Covid-19 official discusses her goals.
first_paragraph: President Biden wants racial equity to be at the essence of a fair national coronavirus response. And Dr. Marcella Nunez-Smith, a Yale epidemiologist who grew up in the U.S. Virgin Islands, is in charge of the effort.

title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is barred from Instagram over false coronavirus claims.
first_paragraph: Instagram took down the account of Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the political scion and prominent anti-vaccine activist, on Wednesday over false information related to the coronavirus.

title: ‘Race and Place Matter’: A Biden Adviser Tackles Coronavirus Inequities
first_paragraph: President Biden has said repeatedly that racial equity will be at the core of his coronavirus response. Dr. Marcella Nunez-Smith is in charge of making that happen.

first_paragraph: and some of them were used by health care workers in Washington State, the federal authorities said on Wednesday in announcing an investigation.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
first_paragraph: The United States is having a brutal winter, having recorded half of all of its deaths during the pandemic since Nov. 1. But after several dark months, the country is showing some positive signs.

title: How Has the Pandemic Reshaped Your Values?
first_paragraph: For nearly everyone, the coronavirus pandemic has been a seismic, transformative event, like the death of a parent, the birth of a child or a difficult diagnosis. Our lives now have a clear “before” and a clear “after.” This past year has pushed us to reckon with our deepest questions, about how we live, how we suffer and how we make meaning of our time on this earth.

title: Teachers’ Union Leaders Face a Tough Test Over School Reopening
first_paragraph: Today, union leaders struggle with reopening conflicts, and our colleague Erica L. Green writes about what she chose to do with her daughter’s schooling this year.

title: How We Decided to Send Our Daughter Back to School
first_paragraph: I still remember the nauseating feeling that consumed me when I put my daughter on a school bus two years ago and sent her off to prekindergarten.

title: Chicago’s teachers approve a deal that would send students back to the classroom.
first_paragraph: After a two-week pause of in-person instruction, the Chicago Teachers Union said early Wednesday that its members had approved an agreement to reopen classrooms in the country’s third-largest public school system.

title: As Biden Pushes for Racial Equity in Vaccination, Data Is Lagging
first_paragraph: Federal health officials are struggling to gather accurate data on the race and ethnicity of people being vaccinated against the coronavirus, hampering President Biden’s push for racial equity in a pandemic that has taken a disproportionate toll on communities of color.

title: Next week, Biden will take his first major trip outside of Washington as president.
first_paragraph: President Biden will travel to Milwaukee on Tuesday to participate in a CNN town hall event, his first substantive trip outside of Washington since assuming office at a time when the coronavirus pandemic has substantially limited presidential travel.

title: Colleges vowed a safer spring, but then students, and variants, arrived.
first_paragraph: With nearly a year of coronavirus experience behind them, leaders at many universities in the United States ushered in the new term pledging not to repeat the errors of last year, when infection rates soared on campuses and in the surrounding communities.

title: How Biden United a Fractious Party Under One Tent
first_paragraph: For years, Bernie Sanders and Joseph R. Biden Jr. wrestled over the Democratic Party’s future in a public tug of war that spanned three elections, two administrations and one primary contest.

title: Anthony Sowell, Serial Killer Who Terrorized Cleveland, Dies at 61
first_paragraph: Anthony Sowell, who terrorized the city of Cleveland with a macabre series of murders and hid the decomposing bodies of 11 Black women at his home, died on Monday of an undisclosed terminal illness, a spokeswoman for Ohio’s corrections agency said. He was 61.

title: ‘Its Own Domestic Army’: How the G.O.P. Allied Itself With Militants
first_paragraph: Dozens of heavily armed militiamen crowded into the Michigan Statehouse last April to protest a stay-at-home order by the Democratic governor to slow the pandemic. Chanting and stomping their feet, they halted legislative business, tried to force their way onto the floor and brandished rifles from the gallery over lawmakers below.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
first_paragraph: Just as South Africa was preparing to distribute its first million doses of AstraZeneca’s coronavirus vaccine, devastating news emerged: A clinical trial failed to demonstrate that the vaccine offered protection against mild or moderate illness caused by the South African variant, which is estimated to make up 90 percent of all cases there.

title: Representative Ron Wright of Texas dies after battling Covid-19.
first_paragraph: Representative Ron Wright, Republican of Texas, died on Sunday after battling Covid-19 in the hospital, his office said on Monday. He was 67.

title: Chicago Teachers Tentatively Agree to Return to Classrooms
first_paragraph: The Chicago Teachers Union has reached a tentative deal with Mayor Lori Lightfoot to partially reopen the city’s schools for in-person classes starting this week, the mayor announced on Sunday.

title: Democrats to Unveil Up to $3,600 Child Tax Credit as Part of Stimulus Bill
first_paragraph: Top House Democrats are preparing to unveil legislation that would send up to $3,600 per child to millions of Americans, as lawmakers aim to change the tax code to target child poverty rates as part of President Biden’s sweeping $1.9 trillion stimulus package.

title: Without a big aid bill like Biden’s, jobs will be slow to rebound, Yellen warns.
first_paragraph: The U.S. labor market is stalling and in a “deep hole” that could take years to escape if lawmakers do not quickly pass an aid package that gives workers a bridge to the end of the pandemic, Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen warned on Sunday.

title: The Super Bowl brings fears of another coronavirus surge.
first_paragraph: Just as the United States seems to have emerged from the worst of a surge in coronavirus cases that ravaged the country for months and peaked after Americans crowded indoors for the winter holidays, public health officials are concerned about another potential superspreader date: Super Bowl Sunday.

title: Anti-Vaccine Activists Emboldened in California
first_paragraph: An out-of-work stand-up comic originally from New Jersey. An actor and conservative podcast host dressed in a white lab coat. A gadfly who has run several unsuccessful campaigns for Congress in Los Angeles. And at least a few who had been in Washington the day of the Capitol riot.

title: Pushing QAnon and Stolen Election Lies, Flynn Re-emerges
first_paragraph: In Washington’s respectable circles, Michael T. Flynn, the former national security adviser, is a discredited and dishonored ex-general, a once-esteemed military intelligence officer who went off the rails ideologically and then was fired a mere 24 days into the Trump administration for lying to the F.B.I. about contacts with the Russian ambassador.

title: Biden Wants Harris to Have a Major Role. What It Is Hasn’t Been Defined.
first_paragraph: President Biden was rattling off a list of his priorities for a coronavirus relief bill in one of his first meetings with reporters as commander in chief when he stopped midsentence to correct himself.

title: Migrant Families Force Biden to Confront New Border Crisis
first_paragraph: President Biden’s first immigration crisis has already begun as thousands of families have surged toward the southwestern border in recent weeks, propelled by expectations of a friendlier reception and by a change in Mexican policy that makes it harder for the United States to expel some of the migrants.

title: Immunization Expert Accuses C.D.C. and Deloitte of Stealing Her Idea
first_paragraph: Last spring, when coronavirus vaccines were just a glimmer of hope, the Trump administration awarded the first of two no-bid contracts worth up to $44 million to a national consulting firm to help patients register to be immunized and states collect detailed data on vaccine recipients.

title: Supreme Court Partly Backs Religious Challenge to California Virus Restrictions
first_paragraph: A splintered Supreme Court on late Friday night partly lifted restrictions on religious services in California that had been prompted by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Summer School Is a Hot Idea Right Now. Could It Work?
first_paragraph: The idea makes sense, so much so that at least two governors, a national union leader and President Biden are behind it: extend this school year into the summer to help students make up for some of the learning they lost during a year of mostly remote school.

title: ‘The vice president votes in the affirmative’: Here’s how Kamala Harris broke her first Senate tie.
first_paragraph: It was, somehow, a setting simultaneously dramatic and anticlimactic for Vice President Kamala Harris’s first tiebreaking vote in the Senate: just before dawn in a sparsely filled chamber, at the end of a 15-hour session in which senators voted on dozens of amendments to one of the largest stimulus packages in American history.

title: How Does a City Host a Super Bowl in a Pandemic?
first_paragraph: The big, national party that is Super Bowl Sunday, with families and friends cozying up on the couch and sharing shrimp platters and beers in front of the television, represents a dangerous potential for new coronavirus infections across the country.

title: Senate Backs Biden’s Stimulus, But Rejects Quick Minimum Wage Increase

title: Can’t Get a Shot? Thousands of ‘Vaccine Hunters’ Are Crossing State Borders to Get Theirs
first_paragraph: When Chanel Maronge saw on Facebook that she was eligible to get a Covid-19 vaccine, she seized the opportunity. The only catch? She had to cross the state line to Mississippi last week, driving an hour and a half from her home in Baton Rouge, La., to get her first shot.

title: Lawmaker Promoted Stem Cell Therapy for Covid-19 in Fraud Scheme, U.S. Says
first_paragraph: A state lawmaker in Missouri was charged this week in connection with a fraud scheme in which she claimed she could use stem cells to treat Covid-19 patients at her medical clinics, prosecutors said.

title: Democrats Press Ahead on Stimulus as Biden Signals Openness to Changes

first_paragraph: The odds that Democrats will succeed in passing a large economic rescue package received a boost this week from an unexpected source: Gov. Jim Justice of West Virginia, a Republican. Mr. Justice said on Monday, in back-to-back interviews with CNN and MSNBC, that Congress should “go big” and not worry about the federal deficit.

title: Biden to Welcome More Refugees, but Far From All Will Get In

title: Biden Administration Faces Backlog of 380,000 Waiting to Immigrate

title: Judge Postpones Guantánamo Court Appearances, Citing Pandemic

Zients, the White House’s Covid-19 response coordinator, announced on Tuesday.

title: 77 Days: Trump’s Campaign to Subvert the Election

There was no substantial evidence of election fraud, and there were nowhere near enough “irregularities” to reverse the outcome in the courts.

title: Never mind the skeptics, officials say: Hank Aaron’s death had nothing to do with the Covid-19 vaccine.
first_paragraph: On Jan. 5, Hank Aaron, the legendary home run hitter, posted on Twitter that he had been vaccinated for the coronavirus at the Morehouse School of Medicine, along with other prominent civil rights figures in Atlanta who were 75 or older and thus part of the group at the highest priority to be inoculated.

title: Pentagon Halts Plan to Vaccinate the 40 Prisoners at Guantánamo Bay

title: Copying Roosevelt, Biden Wanted a Fast Start. Now Comes the Hard Part.

title: A California University Tries to Shield an Entire City From Coronavirus
first_paragraph: The coronavirus test center on A Street was bustling on a recent morning. Michael Duey was in line, as usual, with his teenage son. Margery Hayes waited for her wife in the parking lot. Dr. Elizabeth Pham hustled her children in for a quick pit stop.

title: Federal Court Lifts Block on Trump Policy Expelling Migrant Children at the Border

title: A ‘Race’ to Vaccinate, After South Africa Variant Is Detected in South Carolina

title: In Biden’s White House, Masks, Closed Doors and Empty Halls

title: The Impact of Teacher Deaths

title: Biden Moves to Expand Health Coverage in Pandemic Economy

title: The variant that emerged in South Africa is reported in the U.S. for the first time.

title: Whitmer pleads with Michigan lawmakers to find common ground amid the pandemic.
